description: Guided walking tours of the grounds of Bethlem Royal Hospital, taking in the Hospital's historic Chapel, its beautiful grounds, Bethlem Museum of the Mind, and Bethlem Gallery. Open House 2023 tours delivered as part of This is Croydon, London Borough of Culture, with the support of Mayor of London and Croydon Council.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: Although Bethlem Royal Hospital is the oldest psychiatric institution with a continous history from 1247 to the present, its move to the south-eastern suburbs of London took place in the early twentieth century, and it is the only surviving example in England of a hospital built according to the continental 'villa system'. Tours will introduce visitors to the Hospital's history as well as to its contemporary mental healthcare practice.

location.address: Bethlem Museum of the Mind, Beckenham, BR3 3BX
travel_info: Additional travel info: The steps and ramp up to the entrance of the imposing building 150 yards into the Hospital site on Monks Orchard Road, and directly in front of you as you walk through the Hospital gates, form the assembly point for the walking tours. This is approximately 1 kilometre from Eden Park station. The 356 bus to Monks Orchard / Shirley stops just a few yards from the Hospital gates.
